name: File_DeleteFromTask
description: Deletes the specified task file from the compute node where the task ran.

jobId.description: The id of the job that contains the task.

taskId.description: The id of the task whose file you want to delete.

fileName.description: The path to the task file that you want to delete.

recursive.description: Sets whether to delete children of a directory. If the fileName parameter represents a directory instead of a file, you can set Recursive to true to delete the directory and all of the files and subdirectories in it. If Recursive is false then the directory must be empty or deletion will fail.

timeout.description: Sets the maximum time that the server can spend processing the request, in seconds. The default is 30 seconds.

client-request-id.description: Caller generated request identity, in the form of a GUID with no decoration such as curly braces e.g. 9C4D50EE-2D56-4CD3-8152-34347DC9F2B0.

return-client-request-id.description: Specifies if the server should return the client-request-id identifier in the response.

ocp-date.description: The time the request was issued. If not specified, this header will be automatically populated with the current system clock time.

$block: An error response received from the Azure Batch service.

$ul: **code**: Gets or sets an identifier for the error. Codes are invariant and are intended to be consumed programmatically.
**message**: An error message received in an Azure Batch error response.
**lang**: Gets or sets the language code of the error message
**value**: Gets or sets the text of the message.
**values**: Gets or sets a collection of key-value pairs containing additional details about the error.
